author: Kiiranaux
title: Watch out for the stickers!
review:
With city sets and the like, I prefer to leave a detailed review about the parts and the building experience. Here, I'm going for a much simpler message - this is a beautiful set, but watch out for the stickers!

There are a lot of small stickers in this set that are used to make up the "scales" of the dragon, both its red hide and white underbelly. You won't realise this at first, but the stickers all have little letter "u"'s on them representing scales, and every sticker in the set has the "u"'s facing the same way! You need to really look at the detail of each sticker and use some common sense (and read the instructions) to make sure you're not putting the sticker on backwards. If you apply them all correctly, you're rewarded with a continuous flow motion that looks really beautiful and adds to the natural appeal of the maroon, white, and blue protector dragon.

For this reason, I would also not recommend buying this set secondhand on ebay, since in addition to the usual child-placed misalignment of stickers, you are also likely to have to deal with backwards stickers even from the adults.

Otherwise, it's a beautiful set, the dragon is made of very interesting building techniques (although the build itself is just a tiny bit repetitive), and the pieces are beautiful. Great minifigure selection. Also, the dragon is HUGE, it's like 18 long from head to tail, and maybe more. With the parts, it's not hard to imagine making some other kind of fantasy creature, such as a nan, with these parts. And the head, which uses different parts as horns and whiskers, is a highlight of the build.

Anyway, I do recommend the set, just watch out for those stickers and make sure you line them up right!
